page.title: 12CLINTON PARK
page.content: The{Clinton Park estate}is made up of {10 Courts}of{32 terraced houses}of between{2 and 4}bedrooms.The courts are all named after poets,namely Auden,Browning,Coleridge,Dryden,Eusden ,FitzGerald,Goldsmith,Herrick,Johnson and Keble.The estate was{begun in 1972 and finished in 1973.The houses belong to the R.A.F.There is also a N.A.A.F.I on the site plus a small recreation area for children with swings,etc. Clinton Park County Primary School is also on the site but as its name suggests has no connection with the R.A.F.The school{opened in September {1972.}There are about{120 children on roll.The head,who teaches full time,has three full time staff plus one part timer.A caretaker,a welfare assistant in the infants' department and a part time secretary are also employed.
